meanings.def: fine soft thread produced by silkworms
examples: The caterpillar spins the silk around its entire body.

meanings.def: a type of fine smooth cloth made from silk thread; a piece of this cloth
examples: Her skin was as smooth as silk.
a drawing room decorated in rich blue and purple silks

meanings.def: thread made of silk used for sewing
clothes made of silk, especially the coloured shirts worn by people riding horses in a race (= jockeys)
a type of lawyer who represents the government (= a King’s Counsel / Queen’s Counsel)
examples: to take silk (= to become this type of lawyer)

meanings.def: (you won't) succeed in making something good out of material that does not seem very good at all

idioms.idiom: (you can't) make a silk purse out of a sow’s ear
